questions.question: One of my friends ............................ in Romania.
questions.description: Here the subject is the singular expression one.

questions.question: Each of the boys ............................... given a booklet.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after each and every.

questions.question: Oil and water ............................... not mix.
questions.description: When we connect two singular subjects with and, the verb should be plural.

questions.question: Slow and steady ................................ the race.
questions.description: When two singular nouns together express one idea, the verb is singular.

questions.question: Either Sam or Maria ................................. responsible for this.
questions.description: When you connect two singular nouns with either/or, the verb is singular.

questions.question: Either Samuel or his friends ............................... taken the money.
questions.description: When we connect a singular and a plural subject with either/or, the verb agrees with the subject nearest to it.

questions.question: There .................................. a lot of mangoes on the tree.
questions.description: When the noun following there is plural, the verb is plural.

questions.question: There .............................. a lot of work to do.
questions.description: When the noun following there is singular, the verb is singular.

questions.question: Where .................................. you been all this while?
The boss and her secretary ............................... lunch together.
Neither of these hats .................................... your face.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after neither.

questions.question: Everyone ..................................... honest people.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after everyone.
